description: Use channel-specific language with concrete examples. For Domain/API: show actual method calls. For CLI: show actual command syntax. For Panel/UI: show actual interactions and display elements. Don't use generic 'Bot does X' or 'System does Y' - be specific to the channel.

do.description: Frame acceptance criteria in terms of how that channel actually works. Domain: method calls. CLI: command syntax. Panel: UI interactions.

guidance.description: Domain/API stories: Use actual resource/object names and method signatures
example: WHEN Story Graph Node creates new child Node
THEN parent Story Node creates new child node of appropriate type
(Example: child = bot.story_graph.epics["epic name"].createChild("child name"))

guidance.description: CLI stories: Show actual command syntax with dot notation or flags
example: WHEN User enters dot notation to create new child
EXAMPLE: cli.story_graph."Invoke Bot".create_sub_epic."Manage Bot Information"
THEN CLI parses dot notation path to parent node

guidance.description: Panel/UI stories: Show specific UI elements, interactions, and visual feedback
example: WHEN User selects Epic node in Story Tree
THEN Panel shows "Create Sub-Epic" button in action panel to the right
BUT does not show "Create Story" button

guidance.description: Include concrete examples in parentheses showing actual usage
example: (Example: child = bot.story_graph.epics["epic name"].createChild("child name", 2))
(Example: cli.story_graph."Invoke Bot".move_to."Other Epic".at_position.2)

dont.description: Don't use generic 'Bot', 'System', or 'User' without showing how it actually works in that channel. Example: Don't say 'Bot creates node' - show the actual API call or command

guidance.description: Don't use generic domain language that could apply to any channel
example: WHEN Bot creates child node
THEN Bot validates parent exists
AND Bot adds child to parent

guidance.description: Don't describe UI interactions without showing actual UI elements
example: WHEN User creates node in panel
THEN Panel displays node

guidance.description: Don't describe CLI without showing actual command syntax
example: WHEN User enters command to move node
THEN CLI validates command
AND CLI executes move

guidance.description: Don't omit examples for domain/API stories
example: WHEN Story Graph Node moves to parent
THEN node adds itself to target
